elements.title: Khalwa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Khalwa (pupils pictured) is an educational institute that tackles illiteracy in Sudan and neighbouring countries?

elements.title: Lorenzo Carfora (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that on 1 March 2023, Lorenzo Carfora became the first player born in 2006 to feature in a Serie B match?

elements.title: Tianzhou 6 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after significant modifications of the Tianzhou cargo spacecraft, Tianzhou 6 is the world's largest active cargo spacecraft by capacity?

elements.title: Kim Hamilton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after coming second to Kim Hamilton in floor exercise at two NCAA Gymnastics Championships, Corrinne Wright tied with her the next year after tumbling to music from Who Framed Roger Rabbit?

elements.title: Katyusha Maslova (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while Dmitri Shostakovich composed his opera Katyusha Maslova, Sergei Prokofiev was also contemplating an opera based on the same subject?

elements.title: Mackay Davashe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mackay Davashe wrote "Lakutshona Ilanga", the English version of which, sung by Miriam Makeba, became the first South African piece to chart on the Billboard Hot 100?

elements.title: 2023 CONCACAF Champions League final (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2023 CONCACAF Champions League final was a rematch of a 2020 series played by Club León and Los Angeles FC?

elements.title: Lord Adolphus FitzClarence (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lord Adolphus FitzClarence was said to be too slow due to his "most necessary appendage"?
